messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where should zenmomma move? was Re: Just a vent
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks... we re actually rebuilding! There will be a new & improved Coyotes Corner! We haven t added anything to this (current) page - I need my web designer
messages.messageBody:
Thanks...
we're actually rebuilding! There will be a new & improved Coyotes Corner! We haven't added anything to this (current) page - I need my web designer to do it! ($$$)However, we're using a new program - that is almost as easy as sending e-mail!
We're adding so much stuff! Including a section on homeschooling! Bumper stickers, posters, t-shirts and a page of links.

We really have to get out of here. It gets more & more expensive! We're very environmental - wear layers, etc....we have Lozens gift blankets on our north walls (they really look good!)
We "insulate" the north windows with that 'thinsulate' stuff.
I don't even want to tell you how much we spend on heat!! And then there are other expenses.....

Pool......(sigh)

Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Mary
To: Unschooling list
Sent: Friday, April 18, 2003 10:29 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where should zenmomma move? was Re: Just a vent


From: "coyote's corner" <jana@...>


<<What's the weather like? How are rents?? Here in East Providence, rents
are so very high and it gets so cold here!!
We spend way to much on heat and rent.
Brianna & I are looking to relocate.>>



It's nice and toasty down here. The pool today was down right refreshing!!
We also have a very large Indian community here. You could make a ton with
your items you sell. The things on your website are quite unique from what I
have seen here.

Mary B

What's the weather like? How are rents?? Here in East Providence, rents are so very high and it gets so cold here!!
We spend way to much on heat and rent.
Brianna & I are looking to relocate.


Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Rebecca DeLong
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 18, 2003 6:39 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where should zenmomma move? was Re: Just a vent




zenmomma2kids <zenmomma@...> wrote:

<<<San Diego is lovely. Too expensive for us. :-(>>>

If you rent it's not to bad, and I find that what we save on fresh produce makes up for it.

We spent almost a $1.00 on a bunch of celery when we were in Mich, a few months ago, got home and spent $.19 on it.

Rebecca

messages.subject: Re: Just a vent
messages.msgSnippet: ***Well, we re moving soon. Not really tied to a destination yet. Where exactly are you? :o) Life is good. ~Mary*** I actually can t reccomend moving here,
messages.messageBody:
***Well, we're moving soon. Not really tied to a destination yet. Where
exactly are you? :o)

Life is good.
~Mary***

I actually can't reccomend moving here, it's gotten SO expensive in the
past ten years. But if you can afford $250,000 tract houses, then come
on down!

I'm 1 hour north of Santa Barbara and 1 hour south of San Luis Obispo,
in California. Right on the coast. It's gorgeous here.
(San Diego is nice too ;) )

Kate

messages.subject: Re: Just a vent
messages.msgSnippet: ****it seems unfair to punish her too.
messages.messageBody:
****it seems unfair to punish her too.

<<snip>>

<<Hopefully we'll be able to play with them next week, but only if
Connor
gets his work done. >>

Invite him over and help him do it! <bwg>***

I tried the first one, explaining that we haven't seen them all week and
it it feels like we are all being punished. But Connor is being tested
this week (not sure what that means, it's through the charter school
they use) and they can't skip out on that.

We can't go to their house, they live on a military base, and I was a
bad girl many years ago and did some heavy duty protesting and now I'm
not allowed on any military bases (I've tried, there was a scene).

We are not allowed to help, she doesn't even help him! He has to do it
on his own. We've tried the play at the park while he finishes stuff,
but there's a lot of yelling (by her) and a lot of protesting by him
(rightly so IMHO) and neither of my kids want to do that again.

So we'll wait for them. Maybe they'll stop the school stuff a few weeks
before they move and we can play a little.

Maybe some unschoolers will move here and we'll never hear those excuses
again! It's gorgeous here! Very much like the south of France! (so
says my kid's French godfather). Good hiking! Hint, hint

Kate
who is going to the beach and then the farmer's market for fresh,
no-spray strawberries to make jam with this weekend.
